Keywords: Fantastic Four , Robot
Real Name: Humanoid Experimental Robot, B-Type, Integrated Electronics
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Captain
(+5) YOU HAVE GIVEN A MATCH TO A CHILD WHO LIVES IN A TINDERBOX!: If exactly one friendly character named Mr. Fantastic is on your starting force, he starts the game with the FFFF #s005 Ultimate Nullifier equipped.
FUTURE FOUNDATION HALL MONITOR: Whenever a Sidekick would be KO'd by an opposing effect, you may roll a d6. 4-6: Instead, turn that Sidekick to its last non-KO click and place it in a square adjacent to H.E.R.B.I.E. Gain 2 MISSION POINTS for each Sidekick placed by this effect. (Mission Points: The game ends when, after the resolution of any action, a player has achieved 20 or more MISSION POINTS (from any source). If the game ends this way, the winner is determined by the player with the most MISSION POINTS. In the case of a tie, the active player wins.)
Trade H.E.R.B.I.E. Want H.E.R.B.I.E.

toomanybatmans
He should have a click where he is so annoying that he gets free Incapacitate with a 4 square range in every direction. This represents everybody laughing at his jokes or being so perplexed that they can't figure out what to do next. This keeps the figure in line with the 1970s cartoon!.
July 29, 2021
AluminumMan
I like the idea of putting this guy with a bunch of sidekicks on a team with SWB007b Thanos. This guy saves the kids on their last click just to be KO'd by Thanos to advance his trait. And of course the team would be named the Children of Thanos.

February 11, 2021
Goop
He's ok, you can't push to 18def so you really are getting just a 30pt perplexer with a 50/50 sidekick save. Most of the sidekicks are support pieces anyway so having them on their last click is still fine. A free nullifier for your Mr Fantastic is also a nice little bonus. He's not a bad piece but i dont think he's great either.
